data.title: Lane College announces 2021 Hall of Fame Class
data.meta_description: JACKSON, Tenn. – The Lane College Athletic Department is proud to announce the induction of eight new members to the Hall of Fame Class of 2021 as announced by Director
data.text:
by Joel Worthington

General | 8/8/2021 2:47:00 PM

JACKSON, Tenn. – The Lane College Athletic Department is proud to announce the induction of eight new members to the Hall of Fame Class of 2021 as announced by Director of Athletics, Derrick Burroughs.

"It gives me great honor to announce this astounding induction class," said Burroughs. "These individuals personify what it means to be a Lane College Dragon. The accomplishments that they made on the field and court are just as impressive as the milestones they reached in the classroom, in the community, and currently as alumni. I am looking forward to formally inducting them into our Hall of Fame and celebrating their remarkable careers at Lane during Homecoming Weekend."

The Class of 2021 includes, John Green (Lifetime Achievement), Eric Brent (Football), T. Willie Tyson (Alumni – Coach), Carolyn Jackson (Alumni - Coach), Sherard Ellis (Football), Jasmine McNeil (Softball), Shawnae Campbell (Softball), and the 1982 Lane College Football team.

John Green, Lifetime Achievement, Class of 1964

Hailing from Whiteville, Tennessee, Green has been an avid supporter of Lane College Athletics for over five decades. Whether he is going into his own pocket to help fund projects, using his extensive network to fundraise, or wielding his influence in West Tennessee, Green stops at nothing to ensure that the coaches and players at Lane College are supported and equipped with the necessities to be successful. He serves as the chairman of the Lane College Booster Club and has been a part of the alumni association for over 35 years. He is the personification of the lifetime achievement award.

Eric Brent, Football, 1997-2001

From Covington, Tennessee, Brent was a four-year letterman for the Dragons football team and elected captain his senior year. He earned All-SIAC honors at punter in 2000 when he led the league with 49.2 yards per kick and a long of 72 yards versus Kentucky State. Berry is also a member of the Lane College Hall of Distinction.

T. Willie Tyson, Alumni - Coach, Class of 1967

A local product of Jackson, Tenn., Tyson began his coaching career at Central High School in Alamo, Tennessee where he coached basketball for four years before transferring to Bells High School for two years. Tyson then returned to Jackson and coached the girls' and boys' teams at West Junior High for 20 years. While at West, his teams won 12 district championships and four regional championships. He then moved to South Side High School where he coached the boys' team for 13 years. During that tenure, his teams won four district and regional championships, five sub-state championships, and made the state tournament two times. During his career, he was named Coach of the Year on three occasions while also earning West Tennessee Coach of the Year once, Jackson Sun Coach of the Year three times, and TSSAA All-Tournament Coach once.

Carolyn Caudle Jackson, Alumni – Coach, Class of 1973

Jackson came to Lane College from Chattanooga and graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Physical Education. From 1973-2013 she taught Physical Education and coached girls' basketball and volleyball at Brainard High School. She compiled a career record of 965 wins and 285 losses. In the summer of 2021, Coach Jackson was inducted into the Tennessee Secondary Schools Athletic Hall of Fame. During her tenure, she coached Olympic Gold Medalist Venus Lacey. Her teams made three state finals appearances, winning the title in 1984. Upon her retirement in 2013, the Brainard High School Community co-named the gym in her honor.

Sherard Ellis, Football, 2005-2009

Ellis, a native of Houston, Texas, ended his Lane career completing 672-of-1206 passes for 7,867 yards and 64 touchdowns (all school records). He added 2,297 yards rushing on the ground with 32 touchdowns. He was named First Team All-SIAC in 2006.

Jasmine McNeil, Softball, 2013-2015

A junior college transfer from Los Angeles, California, McNeal was named the 2014 and 2015 SIAC Softball Player of the Year. She hit .497 for her career and scored 85 runs while posting 77 RBI's, 22 home runs, 19 doubles, and 26 stolen bases for the Lady Dragons. She was named First Team All-Region and is the only softball player to receive All-American honors while at Lane College after being named Second-Team utility player.

Shawnae Campbell, Softball, 2013-2015

A product of Lawndale, California, Campbell left Lane as the single season record holder in strikeouts (173), innings pitched (127.2), and saves (5), all of which still stand today. The ace pitcher finished her two-year career at Lane with 20 wins, 299 strikeouts, and a 2.45 ERA. She was named First Team All-SIAC in 2015 as well as being honored as the Reliever of the Year.

1982 Lane College Football team

Led by head coach Neal McCall, the 1982 football team earned the schools only Southern Intercollegiate Athletic Conference championship (Division III). The Dragons finished the season with a 6-2-1 record including wins over Miles College, Fisk University, Baptist University, and others. Earned a tie with the University of Arkansas-Pine Bluff.

The 2021 Hall of Fame Ceremony will be held on Friday, October 1st at 7:00 PM in the J.F. Lane Gymnasium. Please follow the link below and scroll down to the Athletic Hall of Fame section to purchase tickets.

https://lane-college.square.site

To pay by check, please mail to:

Office of Institutional Advancement

545 Lane Ave

Jackson, TN 38301
